hackathon-description-text: HAkron is back for round 2; This time with an arcade! Come hack hardware and software in this fun and FREE 24-hour hackathon. Check out

hackathon-eligibility: All college students who are 18 or older can participate. You must be physically present at the event to submit and be judged.
hackathon-rules:
Our only rules are a max team size of 4, and all work must be completed at the event.
Our hackathon also follows the

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $1000 Cash for the best overall hack. Money is divided between team members.
A pair of Jaybird X3s for each team member
A JBL Flip 4 Bluetooth Speaker for each team member
Amazon Echo Dots for each team member
Philips Hue Starter Kit - Two bulbs and a connector hub for each team member
Boogie Board LCD drawing tablets for each team member
Husban X4 (H107C) Miniature Quad Copter w/ camera for each team member

Tremco is giving $1000 to the best solution for their Leak Locator App - They're looking for an iOS application that accurately reports the position of a leak given user input or on-board device sensors. Attend their information session at 3 on Saturday for more info.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=526 S Main St #511, Akron, OH 44311, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: All Devpost submissions will demo their projects in an Expo to hackers and judges. The top 5 will be selected by the judges (using MIT Gavel) and sent on to the presentation round.
The top 5 teams will present their projects in front of everyone to determine the overall winner of the grand prize, $1000!
Other category winners will be individually judged based on the Expo. See the prizes in the sidebar ->

hackathon-location-address: 526 S Main St #511, Akron, OH 44311, USA
